title: Conquest of Northern Kings
shortSummary: Joshua 11 describes the decisive military campaign led by Joshua against a coalition of northern Canaanite kings. The chapter highlights God's direct guidance and intervention in delivering Israel's enemies into their hands, fulfilling His promises to give the land to His people. It underscores the importance of obedience to God's commands in achieving victory.
timeline: c. 1406 BC - Israel's conquest of Canaan under Joshua's leadership

keyCharacters.name: Joshua
keyCharacters.description: The leader of Israel who commands the army and faithfully obeys God's instructions to conquer the land.

keyCharacters.name: Jabin
keyCharacters.description: King of Hazor who leads a coalition of northern kings against Israel.

keyCharacters.name: Jobab
keyCharacters.description: King of Madon, one of the allied northern kings summoned by Jabin.

keyCharacters.name: The Hivites of Gibeon
keyCharacters.description: A group of Canaanites who made peace with Israel rather than fighting.

definitions.definition: To cut the hamstring tendons of horses, rendering them useless for battle or travel.
Horse-drawn vehicles used in ancient warfare, symbolizing military strength.
A race of giants living in the mountains of Canaan, known for their formidable stature.
A lake in northern Canaan where the coalition of kings gathered to fight Israel.

outline.heading: Formation of the Northern Coalition
outline.description: Jabin king of Hazor gathers allied kings from various regions to oppose Israel, assembling a vast army by the waters of Merom. This coalition represents the resistance of Canaanite peoples against God's chosen people.

outline.heading: God’s Assurance and Israel’s Victory
outline.description: God commands Joshua not to fear and promises total victory, instructing him to disable the enemy’s horses and burn their chariots. Joshua obeys, and Israel defeats the coalition decisively.

outline.heading: Destruction of Hazor and Other Cities
outline.description: Joshua captures Hazor, the head of the northern kingdoms, and destroys it by fire, following Moses’ commands. Other cities are taken and destroyed, demonstrating Israel’s thorough obedience to God’s instructions.

outline.heading: Complete Conquest and Division of the Land
outline.description: Joshua takes the entire northern region, defeats all kings, and leaves no survivors except the Hivites of Gibeon who made peace. The Anakim are cut off except in a few cities, and the land rests from war as it is divided among the tribes.

application: Trust God’s promises and do not fear opposition when carrying out His will, as He is sovereign over all battles.
Obedience to God’s commands is essential for spiritual victory and blessing in our lives.
Recognize that God can harden hearts for His purposes, reminding us to rely on His power rather than human strength.
Seek peace where possible, but be prepared to stand firm against spiritual enemies with God’s help.

keyVerses.text: And the LORD said unto Joshua, Be not afraid because of them: for to morrow about this time will I deliver them up all slain before Israel: thou shalt hough their horses, and burn their chariots with fire.
keyVerses.significance: God’s direct reassurance to Joshua highlights His sovereign control over Israel’s battles and the importance of trusting His guidance.

keyVerses.text: As the LORD commanded Moses his servant, so did Moses command Joshua, and so did Joshua; he left nothing undone of all that the LORD commanded Moses.
keyVerses.significance: This verse emphasizes Joshua’s faithful obedience to God’s commands, a key factor in Israel’s successful conquest.

keyVerses.text: For it was of the LORD to harden their hearts, that they should come against Israel in battle, that he might destroy them utterly, and that they might have no favour, but that he might destroy them, as the LORD commanded Moses.
keyVerses.significance: This reveals God’s sovereign purpose in hardening the enemies’ hearts to fulfill His judgment and promises to Israel.

keyVerses.text: So Joshua took the whole land, according to all that the LORD said unto Moses; and Joshua gave it for an inheritance unto Israel according to their divisions by their tribes. And the land rested from war.
keyVerses.significance: The completion of the conquest and the land’s rest signify God’s faithfulness in fulfilling His covenant promises.
